column4: hello, can someone give me a hint on why my bios would only boot Live USB created under Windows ? sometimes, the sticks created by the same program will not boot with the Linux version (UnetBootin)... I never managed to get a Live USB generated a linux software to work with my computer, when it always does with Windows...
That's because you're overdoing it ;) isohybrid something.iso ; sudo dd if=something.iso of=/dev/sdz (where sdz is your USB stick. Also note that it's sdz, not sdz1)
never heard of that "isohybrid" thing but just the name sounds like a solution to me...
i'm downloading 12.10 daily right now, i'll test it right away
The "isohybrid" part is actually unnecessary with most modern distributions, they provide hybrid ISOs already.
So you won't need it with Ubuntu 12.04 and up
So just the dd bit
It doesn't hurt anything if you do the isohybrid, though, but just saying
in case the regular dd thing won't work, I'll try it
It works with 12.04, I tested it, um, a week ago.
Dunno about 12.10, but if any logic works then it should
ok
You don't have to, but it is a good idea as you won't get updates for such software anymore
is the "Y-my-ppa" (or smth like) software a good way to do so ,
Not even sure what that is
You can use ppa-purge to remove PPAs and simply use apt-get to remove software
Oh, good to hear
I know but how do I check which software comes from ppa and so on ?
I'm not too sure of that.
ok, I'll just try with synaptic
And it can't %)
